Here is an example of how you can use the Advanced Custom Fields (ACF) plugin to create a WordPress snippet for displaying a post, using the HTML structure from the previous example: ```

    Author:

``` This snippet uses the `have_rows` and `the_row` functions provided by ACF to loop through a repeater field named "posts". Within the loop, it uses the `the_sub_field` function to output the values of the sub-fields for each post, such as "link", "image", "categories", "description", and "author". It uses the same HTML structure as previous examples, but with the addition of ACF functions to retrieve the data from the WordPress database and display it on the page. You can modify this as per your requirement, it is just an example, you can add class to each element and can style it with css as per your design.
